page.title: 01THE DODDINGHURST AREA
page.content: This survey area includes the villages of{Doddinghurst, Stondon Massey}and {Kelvedon Hatch}which together with {Blackmore}and{Bentley}are locally known as the Five Parishes. These once isolated villages are now surrounded by large housing estates built on land sold to developers in the fifties and sixties. And, despite the farms which still flourish in the area, the character of the villages and the lifestyle of their inhabitants is suburban rather than rural.{Brentwood, 2 miles away, is the nearest large town;{Chelmsford}is 8 miles distant and{London}is 35 minutes by train from stations at{Shenfield}and Brentwood or, by road, 25 miles on the A12. And now the newly opened{M25, three miles distant, links our area into all the main trunk routes of South East England.
